intro: Marsdenia nicaraguensis, commonly known as the Nicaraguan Marsdenia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apocynaceae family. It is native to Central America, particularly found in Nicaragua and surrounding regions. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical environments, often in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
